thread.title: In ‘Isle of Dogs,’ Wes Anderson Applied Puppet Lessons From ‘Fantastic Mr. Fox’

author: John Jurgensen
title: In ‘Isle of Dogs,’ Wes Anderson Applied Puppet Lessons From ‘Fantastic Mr. Fox’
text:
For the filmmaker Wes Anderson, diving back into a realm of talking animals meant re-immersing himself in puppets and the people who bring them to life.
To make 2009’s “Fantastic Mr. Fox,” he schooled himself in stop-motion animation, eventually scoring an Oscar nomination for best animated feature. In an interview this week, he says that having that production system and many of the same collaborators helped him with his second stop-motion movie, “Isle of Dogs,” opening Friday.
